item.title: Does Half Sword Have Multiplayer? Co-op & PvP Release Details, Explained
item.content:encoded:
Your life is on the line in Half Sword: Two combatants, two weapons, one winner, and a lot of blood spilled. Half Sword is a combat game designed to unleash the sadistic and barbaric medieval animal in you, and multiplayer or co-op would make it even more of a blood-filled blast.

It may seem hard to believe, but civilization is slightly more civilized than it was a few hundred years ago—even if that is hard to believe. Half Sword takes us back in time to a more open age where duels-to-the-death were as common as bread. It requires two people, but does Half Sword require human or AI opponents?

Can You Play Half Sword In Multiplayer or Co-op?

The white flag needs to be waved on Half Sword co-op or multiplayer for now, with developer Half Sword Games confirming that there is no multiplayer present at the game’s launch.

Insider Gaming will hand it over to the official Half Sword Discord FAQ to clear this one up:

“We fully understand the appeal of multiplayer and especially PvP. However, we also wish to draw your attention to the fact that physics-based multiplayer on Unreal Engine 5 is as hardcore as it gets as far as development: it is no easy task & Half Sword is our first game. We are focusing on single-player physics right now to build a strong experience aimed at offering hundreds if not thousands of hours of fun.”

Developer Half Sword Games is clearly putting a lot of time and effort into this project, with a view to this being a long-term goal. So, while there’s no multiplayer at launch, it’s not being ruled out.

Half Sword Multiplayer Release Date

According to the developer, a “polished multiplayer experience” is the long-term goal for Half Sword.

The core focus is on single-player. Despite this being a game tailor-made for two real people, the physics and enormity of the gameplay mean a lot more work is needed to ensure a stable base.

The FAQ says: “Are we able to offer multiplayer at release: highly unlikely. Will we do our utmost to provide multiplayer after release: more likely.”

It does seem like Half Sword is destined for multiplayer, doesn’t it? There’s still plenty to enjoy, even if it is only a single-player game for now. Is a lack of multiplayer a dealbreaker? Let us know your thoughts through the Insider Gaming Discord Server.

item.title: Kingdom Come: Deliverance PS5 Upgrade Revealed by PlayStation Store
item.content:encoded:
The PlayStation Store was recently updated with a new production description for Kingdom Come: Deliverance, and it unveils something fans have been curious about for a while. It points to a PS5 upgrade being released soon for the sensational medieval RPG, which will include 4K resolutions, a boosted framerate, and high-resolution textures.

This follows a rumor that surfaced in October 2025 suggesting that such an upgrade would emerge early in 2026.

KCD is Getting the Upgrade Treatment

Last year, Kingdom Come: Deliverance II was released by Warhorse Studios, several years after the first game spawned off the back of a successful Kickstarter project. The sequel was a mindblowing title, bursting with cinematic storytelling, authentic combat sequences, and some of the best acting we’ve seen in a hot minute in the gaming space.

Following in the footsteps of that delivery, the first title, released in 2018, appears to be getting a current-gen upgrade, thanks to the PlayStation Store.

It was recently discovered that a PS5 upgrade is incoming for the nearly eight-year-old medieval RPG. On the game’s PS Store page, the product description was recently updated to include:

The PS5 version of Kingdom Come: Deliverance now features graphical updates including 4K resolution, improved framerate, high-resolution textures and many more. Medieval Bohemia has never been so beautiful.

(Thanks to Rino for the spot)

It’s a safe bet it’ll also land on Xbox, of course.

It’s probably a stock-standard upgrade, and it’s not the re-release that some were hoping for, but that doesn’t take anything away from the thing. Kingdom Come: Deliverance is a masterful title that simply must be experienced, as it opens the door to the adventure that is Kingdom Come: Deliverance II, which is worth every one of the many hours you’ll sink into it.

That’s what our full review said about it, anyway.

Are you looking forward to exploring a potential PS5 upgrade for Kingdom Come: Deliverance? Let us know on the Insider Gaming Discord server.

item.title: February’s Free PlayStation Plus Games Announced
item.content:encoded:
Sony has announced the free games coming for PlayStation Plus members in February. As per usual, the games will be available for all active PlayStation Plus subscribers.

Starting on February 3, members will have four games from different genres to add to their library.

The headline game in February will be Undisputed from Steel City Interactive. First reported on earlier this week, Undisputed joins the catalog roughly 15 months after it’s 1.0 release.

Also coming is survival action-adventure game Subnautica: Below Zero, science fiction title Ultros, and the combat flight game Ace Combat 7: Skies Unknown.

As mentioned, the games will be available starting February 3 until March 2. Simply adding them to your library will give you continued access to install them when you want, as long as you have an active subscription.

If you haven’t yet, you have until February 2 to add January’s free games to your library. Those games include Need For Speed: Unbound, Disney’s Epic Mickey: Rebrushed, and Core Keeper. Again, you don’t have to download them right away to add them to your account.

item.title: New Witcher Spinoff Title Releasing Next Month
item.content:encoded:
Reigns: The Witcher by Nerial and Devolver Digital releases for iOS, Android, Mac, and PC on February 25, 2026.

In recent days, we have been hearing a lot about the current and upcoming instalments of The Witcher series, including the rumoured expansion for The Witcher 3 and the development and marketing budgets for The Witcher 4. However, today we aren’t talking about any of these titles, but a spinoff within a choice-based title, Reigns.

Reigns: The Witcher Release Date Set for February 2026

Nerial and Devolver Digital have teamed up with CD Projekt Red to introduce a new spinoff titled Reigns: The Witcher, as announced in the recent reveal trailer. This game will incorporate Reigns’ signature decision-driven gameplay into The Witcher universe, featuring Geralt of Rivia as he navigates the ballads of Dandelion. Players will have the opportunity to explore a unique narrative experience, making choices that may involve running a hot bath instead of slaying monsters.

The game will also feature beloved characters from the series, including Yennefer, Triss, and Vesemir. Players can look forward to numerous combat mini-games, where Geralt will face off against familiar foes such as ghouls and rotfiends. Ultimately, the decisions made throughout the game will have significant consequences; a wrong choice could provoke the mages, while the right choice could earn you respect among the nobles.

In other news, The Witcher 3’s rumoured expansion could take players to a new region. Additionally, Netflix’s live-action adaptation will conclude in 2026. Will you be playing Reigns: The Witcher once it releases next month? Leave your thoughts down in the comments, and join the official Insider Gaming Discord server.
